beer.beer_description:
Brewed to celebrate our first birthday, we really pulled out all the stops for this one. Beginning with a variety of English-style and specialty malts, plus a decoction mash, to build deep colour and biscuity toffee flavours. Two different strains of English ale yeast then contributed esters of fruit and spice during fermentation. And finally we generously dry-hopped the beer with Challenger hops to balance out all that maltiness and add a nice orange-peel character.

Although there’s a lot going on, it’s a balanced and drinkable beer that goes down smoooooooth (thanks in part to a touch of nitro added at the end of the carbonation process).

user.first_name: Klaus Kinski lives in my tinglehole (Call 911)
user.bio: South of South Austin.  Boat rocker for life. Hey, yo....

items.badge_description: Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 10 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.badge_description: At a new place and don't want to choose a pint of something you may not like? Grab a few tasters! Enjoy some small pours and then decide which to upgrade to a full pour. That's 155 checkins with the serving style of Taster. Try 5 more for Level 32! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 295 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 60!

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 90 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 19!
Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 140 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 29.
